definition: Gorbachev/Mikhail Sergeyevich Gorbachev (1931-), last president of the Soviet Union 1991-1995
dagger-axe/abbr. for 戈瑞[ge1 rui4]/(Tw) abbr. for 戈雷[ge1 lei2]
surname Ge
variant of 爾|尔[er3]
thus/so/like that/you/thou
Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail
tall
surname Qiao
(classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)
husband/man/manual worker/conscripted laborer (old)

sentences.english: Gorbachev has pursued some more eclectic interests as well.
sentences.chinese: 此外，戈尔巴乔夫的兴趣可谓不拘一格。

sentences.english: This is also not what Gorbachev hoped for.
sentences.chinese: 这也是戈尔巴乔夫始料不及之处。

sentences.english: However, his remarks also show that he has not taken a big step.
sentences.chinese: 但戈尔巴乔夫讲话也表明，他的步子迈得并不大。
戈尔巴乔夫也认识一位“简”先生。
戈尔巴乔夫基本没有拥有改革思想的帮手。

sentences.english: Gorbachev’s reforms either were ignored or they were enacted with perverse consequences.
sentences.chinese: 戈尔巴乔夫的改革要么被忽略，要么走回头路。

sentences.english: Mikhail Gorbachev and his wife Raisa are going to board a plane.
sentences.chinese: 戈尔巴乔夫和他的妻子赖莎准备登机。

sentences.english: Well, after Gorbachev the world will never become as it was before.
sentences.chinese: 在戈尔巴乔夫之后世界再也不会回到以前。

sentences.english: The last months before the breakup of the USSR. Gorbachev welcomes the young military man from Uzbekistan.
sentences.chinese: 戈尔巴乔夫正在欢迎来自乌兹别克斯坦的年轻士兵。

sentences.english: Gorbachev hoped that the cooperatives would be the source of entrepreneurship.
sentences.chinese: 戈尔巴乔夫希望合作社能成为企业家精神的源泉。

sentences.english: Gorbachov was an exemplary regional party secretary.
sentences.chinese: 戈尔巴乔夫是个典型的州党委书记。

sentences.english: Gorbachev followed the Soviet tradition to kiss the party comrades as well.
sentences.chinese: 戈尔巴乔夫也不例外，按照苏联传统亲吻党内同志。

sentences.english: Gorbachev had a fundamental coevolutionary insight, says Axelrod.
sentences.chinese: 戈尔巴乔夫具有基本的共同进化洞察力。

definition: Yeltsin (name)/Boris Yeltsin (1931-2007) first post-communist president of Russia 1991-1999
Nikita Khrushchev (1894-1971), secretary-general of Soviet Communist Party 1953-1964
Leonid Brezhnev (1906-1982), Soviet statesman, General Secretary of the Communist Party of the USSR 1966-1982
Soviet Communist Party/abbr. for 蘇聯共產黨|苏联共产党[Su1 lian2 Gong4 chan3 dang3]
Joseph Stalin (1879-1953), Soviet dictator
Richard Nixon (1913-1994), US president 1969-1974/surname Nixon
Vladimir Ilyich Lenin (1870-1924), Russian revolutionary leader
Leon Davidovich Trotsky (1879-1940), early Bolshevik leader, exiled by Stalin in 1929 and murdered in 1940
Medvedyev (name)/Dmitry Anatolyevich Medvedev (1965-), Russian lawyer and politician, president of Russian Federation from 2008
Nikolai Ivanovich Bukharin (1888-1938), Soviet revolutionary theorist, executed after a show trial in 1937
Kliment Voroshilov (1881-1969), Soviet politician and military commander
Stalinism
Brzezinski (name)/Zbigniew Brzezinski (1928-2017), Polish-American academic and politician, US National Security Adviser 1977-1981
Anwar Al Sadat
Le Duan (1907-1986), Vietnamese communist politician
Henry Kissinger (1923-), US academic and politician, Secretary of State 1973-1977
